title: Nicolas Pepe 'has one of Cristiano Ronaldo's qualities that will make him Arsenal success'

Nicolas Pepe will be a success at Arsenal because he shares the same quality as Cristiano Ronaldo .

That is the view of Pepe's former sporting director at Lille, Luis Campos, who sold the player to the Gunners in the summer.

Pepe is yet to get up to speed in the Premier League following his £72 million switch, scoring just one goal which came from the penalty spot.

But Campos had no doubt the 24-year-old will be a hit at the Emirates, just like Ronaldo was at Man Utd.

"In my opinion one of the characteristics of a top, top player is that they like football," Campos told Sky Sports.

(Image: Getty Images)

"I remember working with Cristiano Ronaldo and Kylian Mbappe: they know everything about football. Mbappe knew all the results of the second division in France.

"Nicolas Pepe is like that. He’s another example of the importance of a player liking football.

"After a game he watches the whole game again two times, to make himself more perfect."

Pepe struggled in Arsenal's draw with rivals Man Utd last week, but had a better afternoon in their last clash with Bournemouth .

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

He set up Arsenal's only goal of the game with an in-swinging left-footed corner onto the head of David Luiz.

And Wenger feels there is more to come once Pepe can reproduce the performances he displayed in Ligue 1 last season.

"I like the player and I thought it was a good decision [to sign him]," Wenger told OmniSport ( via Goal ).

"He's not yet completely adapted and you have to give him some time.

(Image: Arsenal FC via Getty Images)

“He looks a little bit to be playing not with the freedom he did in France at the moment.

"I see some characteristics of his game, especially off the ball, that don't happen at the moment."

But the Frenchman did warn that Pepe must start delivering soon, or risk losing his place in the starting XI.

He added: “On the other hand, I must say we have good young players who can play on the flanks, [and] that he will have a fight to keep his position.”
description: The Ivorian winger has arrived to huge expectation at the Gunners but is yet to show why they spent £72 million on him
